story.text: (Adds details)Jan 3 (Reuters) - J.P. Morgan Securities started coverage of IntercontinentalExchange Inc. (ICE.N) with an "overweight" rating and NYMEX Holdings Inc. NMX.N with an "underweight" rating. The brokerage said it added ICE to its focus list and set a price target of $178 on the stock. In a research note, the brokerage said it saw significant futures contract volume growth potential for the energy derivatives marketplace, and ICE's merger with the New York Board of Trade should create meaningful synergies. On NYMEX, the brokerage said although trading fundamentals are strong and cost-cutting potential significant, it finds valuation stretched and advised investors to wait for a better entry point. (Reporting by Supantha Mukherjee in Bangalore)
story.title: update 1 - research alert - jp morgan starts ice , nymex
